article.title: Vive la radiorésistance!: converging research in radiobiology and biogerontology to enhance human radioresistance for deep space exploration and colonization
funding: The studies were partially supported by the Russian Foundation for Basic Research grant #17-29-01002 ofi_m.
article.abstract: While many efforts have been made to pave the way toward human space colonization, little consideration has been given to the methods of protecting spacefarers against harsh cosmic and local radioactive environments and the high costs associated with protection from the deleterious physiological effects of exposure to high-Linear energy transfer (high-LET) radiation.

sections.introduction: Cosmic radiation and microgravity represent two major environmental contributors to human health risks and substantially limit the prospects of long spaceflights [1].

article.insights_summary: The article discusses the need to enhance human radioresistance for deep space exploration and colonization. It highlights the risks of cosmic radiation and the potential for radioresistance to extend human healthspan. The article proposes various strategies for enhancing human radioresistance, including upregulation of endogenous repair and radioprotective mechanisms, gene therapy, and the use...
